name: Spinach Ricotta Rolls
description: A juicy spinach ricotta filling encased with buttery, flaky puff pastry. Great finger food or to pop into lunch boxes, thought they are definitely best served warm! Refer to the notes for make ahead instructions and the recipe video below. Some people like to serve this with tomato sauce.
recipeIngredient: 250 g / 8 oz   frozen chopped spinach (, thawed (Note 1))
1 ½ cups shredded cheese ((cheddar, tasty, Monterey Jack, Gruyere, Pepper Jack))
Pinch of nutmeg ((fresh grated or powder))

recipeInstructions.text: Place spinach in a colander and use a wooden spoon or your hands to press out excess water. You could also do this using a tea towel or paper towels. Transfer spinach to a bowl (drink the liquid, it’s good for you!).
recipeInstructions.name: Place spinach in a colander and use a wooden spoon or your hands to press out excess water. You could also do this using a tea towel or paper towels. Transfer spinach to a bowl (drink the liquid, it’s good for you!).

recipeInstructions.text: Add remaining Filling ingredients. Mix to combine.
recipeInstructions.name: Add remaining Filling ingredients. Mix to combine.

recipeInstructions.text: Place pastry on work surface and cut in half to create 2 rectangles – you should have 6 in total.
recipeInstructions.name: Place pastry on work surface and cut in half to create 2 rectangles – you should have 6 in total.

recipeInstructions.text: Divide filling between pastries, brush edge with egg then roll up, finishing with the seam side down.
recipeInstructions.name: Divide filling between pastries, brush edge with egg then roll up, finishing with the seam side down.

recipeInstructions.text: Refrigerate for 15 minutes. Meanwhile, preheat oven to 180C/350F.
recipeInstructions.name: Refrigerate for 15 minutes. Meanwhile, preheat oven to 180C/350F.

recipeInstructions.text: Spray 2 x baking trays with oil (any).
recipeInstructions.name: Spray 2 x baking trays with oil (any).

recipeInstructions.text: Cut rolls into 4, or whatever size you want. Brush tops with egg (makes it golden) then sprinkle with sesame seeds.
recipeInstructions.name: Cut rolls into 4, or whatever size you want. Brush tops with egg (makes it golden) then sprinkle with sesame seeds.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake for 25 minutes, then take out the top tray and move the bottom tray to the top and give it an additional 5 - 10 minutes to make it golden.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake for 25 minutes, then take out the top tray and move the bottom tray to the top and give it an additional 5 - 10 minutes to make it golden.

recipeInstructions.text: Best served warm – the pastry is crispier and the filling is juicier. See notes for make ahead instructions.
recipeInstructions.name: Best served warm – the pastry is crispier and the filling is juicier. See notes for make ahead instructions.

review.reviewBody: Whilst I don't recommend making these on a hot and humid Sydney day unless you want a very stretched roll lol they are so yummy - thankfully Nagi recommended some fridge time before baking! Fresh, reheated the next day or out of the freezer these are delicious - everyone loves them!

I made these for Christmas Day brunch and they were a huge hit!

The puff pastry I had comes with 2 sheets in a box, so I slightly reduced the amounts for the filling (but still had enough left to mix with extra eggs for my husband who needs to limit carbs). Also had the creamy ricotta on hand and it worked fine (maybe what we get in the US is different?).

Thanks so much for this delicious recipe!!
Amazing! Love it! Made with fresh large spinach , much better then frozen! Also used ricotta from Italian deli (it wasn't wet at all!)
Served these at a party and had 20 people ask me for the recipe - can't go wrong and freezer friendly! Sublime recipes as always Nagi!

Huge hit with my family.
Will definitely be a regular from here on in ❤️
Just made these as an   appetizer.  They are delicious, and easy to make!

Love the recipe the filling delicious. 
Followed the recipe to a T 
Why did the cheese ooze out both ends
Made these for a party recently and they were a big hit. People loved them.
These were amazing, my first time making them and my partner and I though they were delicious. Definitely going to make them for entertaining or to share at work sometime. Thank you!

Great recipe! I can't believe I made something that looks so fancy and tastes so good :)
I modified the recipe slightly by adding 3 oz. of feta cheese and reduced the ricotta to 9 oz. It made a perfect light supper with a side salad.
These are sooo good, I just ate like 4 in one go! Hehe
These make great light dinner. They’re much tastier-and healthier-than any you can buy in the shops. Thankyou for another great recipe!
